item.title: JFrame won't draw this string
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

package org.flashcard.gui;

import java.awt.Graphics;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;

import javax.imageio.ImageIO;
import javax.swing.JFrame;

import org.flashcard.Constants;
import org.flashcard.gui.listeners.FrontMouseListener;

public class Front extends JFrame {

	private BufferedImage front;

	public void init() {
		try {
			front = ImageIO.read(new File(Constants.frontImageDir));
		} catch (IOException io) {
			io.printStackTrace();
		}
		this.setVisible(true);
		this.setSize(500, 300);
		this.setResizable(false);
		this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		this.setLocationRelativeTo(null);
		this.addMouseListener(new FrontMouseListener());
	}

	@Override
	public void paint(Graphics g) {
		super.paint(g);
		g.drawImage(front, -15, 0, null);
		g.drawString("X: " + this.getX() + " Y: " + this.getY(), 45, 10);
	}

}

This piece of code won’t draw:

Keep in mine these aren’t the first set of coordinates I’ve tried, nothing seems to draw it though. Any ideas?

Read full topic
